benchmark_details.name: Controlled RippleEdit
benchmark_details.overview: Controlled RippleEdit is a new dataset designed to evaluate knowledge propagation capabilities of language models, allowing for focused assessment of generalization by testing relations and entities that were unseen during hypernetwork training.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Evaluate knowledge propagation in language models through a designed set of propagation questions and injected knowledge facts.

data.source: Synthetic generation from structured templates based on fictional stories and well-known entities.
data.annotation: Manually designed templates and paired question-answer sets.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance against validation sets of efficacy and specificity.
methodology.interpretation: Higher LLM-Score indicates better ability of the model to propagate knowledge correctly.
methodology.baseline_results: PropMEND significantly outperformed baselines like Prepend and MEND in both in-domain and out-of-domain settings.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated using cross-validation on separate validation and test splits.
